(Simplified: 鲆)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 平 indicates the sound; 魚 (fish) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 魚 [ yú ] fish
    • 平 [ píng ] flat, level, even; peaceful
①魚的一科，體形側扁，呈片狀，長橢圓形，兩眼都在身體的左側，常見的有“牙鮃”、“斑鮃”等。生活在淺海中，以小動物爲食物。肉可鮮食，肝可制魚肝油。

鮃字的基本解释

鮃
píng
见“鲆”。

鮃字的汉语字典释义

[①]［píng］
［《玉篇》音平］
“鲆1”的繁体字。
鱼类的一科。比目鱼的一类。身体侧扁，呈片状，长椭圆形，有细鳞，左侧灰褐色，有黑色斑点，右侧白色，两眼在左侧。生活在浅海中，右侧向下卧在沙底，以小动物为食物。肉可供食用。鲆科比目鱼种类繁多，我国沿海均有分布。常见的有牙鲆、花鲆、斑鲆等。

鮃字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【魚字部】　鮃； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1467第17
【五音集韻】符兵切，音平。【玉篇】魚名。

Flounder
Basic explanation of words
Flounder
píng
See "Flounder".
Flounder
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［píng］
["Jade Pian" Sound Ping]
Traditional characters for "鲆1".
A family of fish. A type of flounder. The side of the body is flat, flaky, oblong, with fine scales, gray-brown on the left side with black spots, white on the right side, and eyes on the left side. Living in shallow seas, lying down on the sandy bottom on the right side, feeding on small animals. The meat is edible. There are many species of flounder colifish, which are distributed along the coast of our country. Common flounder, Japanese flounder, and Chinese flounder are common.
